description: Demonstration JSON database aggregating verification/validation/benchmark/demonstration cases extracted from the attached NEAMS MSR milestone reports. Designed to support future commercial grade dedication workflows via traceability to source evidence.

requirements.statement: Each validation case shall have a globally unique, stable case identifier.
requirements.rationale: Enables traceability, change control, and cross-report linking for commercial grade dedication (CGD).

requirements.statement: Each case shall reference its source report(s) with a resolvable link and (when known) section/figure/table pointers.
requirements.rationale: Provides evidence provenance required for audits and CGD packages.

requirements.statement: Each case shall be classified by V&V intent (verification, validation, benchmark, demonstration) and by modeling scope (component/integral/system).
requirements.rationale: Supports filtering and graded quality approaches.

requirements.statement: Each case shall record the NEAMS tool(s) and key physics/phenomena exercised.
requirements.rationale: Supports coverage analysis and gap identification.

requirements.statement: Where available, each case shall include quantitative metrics and acceptance criteria (or a placeholder to be filled).
requirements.rationale: Enables objective pass/fail evaluation for qualification and CGD.

requirements.statement: Cases shall support attachment of artifacts (input decks, output datasets, plots) and software configuration metadata (version, commit, environment) when available.
requirements.rationale: Reproducibility and configuration control are CGD essentials.

INL-RPT-24-80404.title: Development of a Computational Framework for Multiphysics Multiphase Species Tracking using NEAMS Tools (FY24 M3 Report)

INL-RPT-24-81124.title: Integration of Thermochimica into MOOSE-based Molten Salt Reactor Loop Simulations (FY24 M2 Report)

INL-RPT-25-88048.title: Initial steady-state core simulation capability for thermal and pool-type molten salt reactors, coupling reactor physics, thermal-hydraulics, and evolving chemistry (M2 Report)

INL-RPT-25-88131.title: Complete Pronghorn Electrochemistry Modeling Improvements for Corrosion and Plating Modeling (FY25 M3 Report)

INL-RPT-25-88371.title: Integrated Molten Salt Reactor Modeling NEAMS Thermal-Hydraulics Tools (FY25 M2 Report)

MSRE_PUMP_STARTUP_VAL_001.title: MSRE pump start-up transient: reactivity loss validation (coupled multiphysics)
MSRE_PUMP_STARTUP_VAL_001.summary: Validation case comparing predicted reactivity loss during MSRE pump start-up against historical MSRE experiment.

source_reports.note: Section 3.4.2; pump start-up reactivity loss comparison (Figure 30).
MSRE integral modeling V&V includes pump start-up transient and validation against MSRE data.

MSRE_PUMP_COASTDOWN_VAL_001.title: MSRE pump coast-down transient: reactivity loss validation (coupled multiphysics)
MSRE_PUMP_COASTDOWN_VAL_001.summary: Validation case comparing predicted reactivity loss during MSRE pump coast-down against historical MSRE experiment.

source_reports.note: Section 3.4.2; pump coast-down reactivity loss comparison (Figure 31).
MSRE integral modeling V&V includes pump coast-down transient and validation against MSRE data.

MSRE_NATURAL_CIRCULATION_VAL_001.title: MSRE natural circulation test: coupled multiphysics validation
MSRE_NATURAL_CIRCULATION_VAL_001.summary: Validation case using MSRE natural circulation tests as experimental reference for the coupled multiphysics model suite.

source_reports.note: Section 4.3: V&V includes natural circulation tests as part of MSRE validation.

MSRE_REACTIVITY_INSERTION_DEM_001.title: MSRE reactivity insertion transient: postulated event demonstration
MSRE_REACTIVITY_INSERTION_DEM_001.summary: Demonstration case (postulated) based on a 5 MW reactivity insertion event to exercise the coupled multiphysics transient capability.

source_reports.note: Section 3.4.3: Reactivity insertion transient (postulated), based on 5 MW insertion parameters.

MSRE_XE_TRANSPORT_DEM_001.title: MSRE Xe-135 transport: equilibrium distribution and reactivity impact (integrated demonstration)
MSRE_XE_TRANSPORT_DEM_001.summary: Integrated demonstration of Xe-135 transport and reactivity in the MSRE; includes graphite noble gas migration model and extended simulation (72 h) to estimate equilibrium distributions.

source_reports.note: Section 7.5: Integrated demonstration of Xe-135 transport and reactivity in the MSRE.

MSRE_XE_POISONING_VAL_001.title: MSRE steady-state xenon poisoning: validation vs measured reactivity change
MSRE_XE_POISONING_VAL_001.summary: Validation against steady-state xenon poisoning measurements; includes parametric studies on Henry’s constant, mass transfer coefficient, and core-average void fraction.

source_reports.note: Section 4.3.9: Xe transport and xenon poisoning validation; includes parametric void fraction study.

MSRE_NOBLE_METAL_TRANSPORT_DEM_001.title: MSRE noble metal transport and deposition: demonstration (e.g., Rh plate-out)
MSRE_NOBLE_METAL_TRANSPORT_DEM_001.summary: Demonstration of noble metal species transport and deposition; example shown for Rh distribution after extended simulation time.

source_reports.note: Section 4.3.10: Noble metal transport; example of Rh distribution after 100,000 s.

TAMU_MSFL_SINGLE_PHASE_VAL_SALT_001.title: TAMU molten salt flow loop (MSFL): 1D SAM model single-phase validation (salt (HITEC))
TAMU_MSFL_SINGLE_PHASE_VAL_SALT_001.summary: Single-phase validation of SAM against TAMU MSFL experimental data using iterative tuning of heat input, cold-leg temperature, and friction factor to match ΔT, velocity, and Prandtl number targets.

source_reports.note: Section 3.2: SAM model of TAMU MSFL; single-phase validation procedure and results tables.

LMSR_HYDRAULICS_BENCHMARK_001.title: Lotus MSR (L-MSR) hydraulics benchmarking and calibration (e.g., vs LES)
LMSR_HYDRAULICS_BENCHMARK_001.summary: Benchmarking effort for L-MSR hydraulics to calibrate or compare flow modeling to reference high-fidelity calculations (e.g., LES), as part of the integrated multiphysics framework.

source_reports.note: Section 5.3.1: Benchmarking of the hydraulics flow modeling for L-MSR.

LMSR_PUMP_STOP_DEM_001.title: L-MSR unprotected pump-driven transient: full pump stop
LMSR_PUMP_STOP_DEM_001.summary: Demonstration case for an unprotected pump-driven transient with a full pump stop.

source_reports.note: Section 5.3.4: Unprotected pump-driven transients; includes full pump stop case.

LMSR_PUMP_POWER_REDUCTION_DEM_002.title: L-MSR unprotected pump-driven transient: 50% pump power reduction
LMSR_PUMP_POWER_REDUCTION_DEM_002.summary: Demonstration case for an unprotected pump-driven transient with a 50% pump power reduction.

source_reports.note: Section 5.3.4: Unprotected pump-driven transients; includes 50% pump power reduction case.

LMSR_NATURAL_CIRCULATION_DEM_003.title: L-MSR natural circulation operation: demonstration
LMSR_NATURAL_CIRCULATION_DEM_003.summary: Demonstration of L-MSR operation in natural circulation mode.

LMSR_FLOW_STOP_SOLIDIFICATION_DEM_004.title: L-MSR flow stop with long-term salt solidification and re-melting: demonstration (control element insertion scenarios)
LMSR_FLOW_STOP_SOLIDIFICATION_DEM_004.summary: Demonstration of long-term salt solidification and re-melting following a flow stop, including parametric insertion of one to four control elements.

source_reports.note: Section 5.3.6: Flow stop with long-term salt solidification and re-melting; multiple control element insertion scenarios.

MSR_TC_PNP_VER_001.title: PNP verification Case 1: Diffusion and migration (equal and opposite charges)
MSR_TC_PNP_VER_001.summary: Electrochemistry verification case comparing against theoretical current densities and/or concentration distributions.

source_reports.note: Verification section: four electrochemical verification cases for the PNP framework.

MSR_TC_PNP_VER_002.title: PNP verification Case 2: Diffusion with equal charges
MSR_TC_PNP_VER_002.summary: Electrochemistry verification case comparing against theoretical current densities and/or concentration distributions.

source_reports.note: Verification section: four electrochemical verification cases for the PNP framework.

MSR_TC_PNP_VER_003.title: PNP verification Case 3: Migration-only

MSR_TC_PNP_VER_004.title: PNP verification Case 4: Potential distribution

source_reports.note: Verification section: four electrochemical verification cases for the PNP framework.

MSR_TC_PNP_VAL_ORNL_LOOP_001.title: PNP corrosion model validation: ORNL natural convection corrosion loop (Cr/Fe concentrations and penetration depth)
MSR_TC_PNP_VAL_ORNL_LOOP_001.system: ORNL natural convection corrosion loop experiment
MSR_TC_PNP_VAL_ORNL_LOOP_001.summary: Validation of the PNP model against ORNL natural convection corrosion loop experimental data; compares concentration profiles and corrosion penetration depths, and end-of-test salt concentrations.

source_reports.note: Validation section: Table 7 and Figure 9 compare predicted vs measured Cr/Fe concentrations and penetration depth.

MSR_TC_LOOP_DEM_2D_001.title: Two-dimensional molten salt loop simulation: species transport / corrosion-plating demonstration
MSR_TC_LOOP_DEM_2D_001.summary: Demonstration of multiphase species transport modeling in a 2D molten salt loop configuration.

source_reports.note: Demonstration sections include 2D loop simulation showcasing integrated capabilities.

MSR_TC_LOOP_DEM_3D_001.title: Three-dimensional molten salt loop simulation: species transport / corrosion-plating demonstration
MSR_TC_LOOP_DEM_3D_001.summary: Demonstration of multiphase species transport modeling in a 3D molten salt loop configuration.

source_reports.note: Demonstration sections include 3D loop simulation showcasing integrated capabilities.

MSR_TC_FULL_MSR_LOOP_DEM_001.title: Full MSR loop simulation: coupled corrosion + noble metal plating demonstration (MSRE and MCRE)
MSR_TC_FULL_MSR_LOOP_DEM_001.summary: Demonstration of full-loop coupled modeling including corrosion and noble metal plating for MSR systems (MSRE and MCRE).

source_reports.note: Full MSR loop demonstration includes MSRE and MCRE examples.

MSR_TC_FLUORINATION_PULSE_DEM_001.title: Fluorination pulse transient: demonstration of off-gas / species removal transient
MSR_TC_FLUORINATION_PULSE_DEM_001.summary: Demonstration of a fluorination pulse transient to exercise transient chemistry-driven species removal in a loop model.

source_reports.note: Fluorination pulse transient demonstration section.

MCRE_CORROSION_PLATING_DEM_001.title: MCRE long-duration corrosion + noble metal plating: PNP-based transient simulation (10 million seconds)
MCRE_CORROSION_PLATING_DEM_001.system: Molten Chloride Reactor Experiment (MCRE) loop (open-source configuration)
MCRE_CORROSION_PLATING_DEM_001.summary: Example case using an open-source MCRE configuration with a PNP framework to model corrosion and noble-metal plating over extended operational periods (10 million seconds ≈ 115.7 days).

source_reports.note: Example case: open-source MCRE long-duration corrosion and plating transient with PNP framework.

MSRE_SPECIES_TRACKING_SS_DEM_001.title: MSRE steady-state species tracking: 91-isotope depletion chain at 10 MWd/kgHM burnup
MSRE_SPECIES_TRACKING_SS_DEM_001.summary: Steady-state MSRE simulation using a 91-isotope depletion chain at burnup 10 MWd/kgHM, producing isotopic mass and concentration distributions.

source_reports.note: Section 4.3.1: Steady-state operation with 91 depletion chain at 10 MWd/kgHM.

MSRE_SPECIES_TRACKING_RI_DEM_002.title: MSRE reactivity insertion transient: 300 pcm at t=0.1 s (species tracking framework)
MSRE_SPECIES_TRACKING_RI_DEM_002.summary: Transient MSRE case with a 300 pcm reactivity insertion at t=0.1 s and total simulation time of 1 s.

source_reports.note: Section 4.3.2: Reactivity insertion transient (300 pcm at t=0.1 s, 1 s total).

MSTDB_TP_ML_VAL_001.title: MSTDB-TP thermal property prediction: 1D CNN model cross-validation and test-set assessment
MSTDB_TP_ML_VAL_001.system: ML surrogate for salt thermophysical properties
MSTDB_TP_ML_VAL_001.summary: Validation-style evaluation of ML models trained to predict thermal properties (boiling point, melting point, density, viscosity, thermal conductivity, heat capacity) from MSTDB-TP; assessed with 10-fold CV and held-out test set.

metrics.name: cross_validation_summary
metrics.value: Avg R2 > 0.90 for most properties; MAPE < 10% except boiling point (per report tables).

source_reports.note: Section 3.4: ML model assessment for predicting thermal properties from MSTDB-TP; 10-fold cross-validation summary.
